info.name: Oracle Fusion Cloud FIN - Tax Registrations
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials â€” Tax Registrations module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Tax Registrations

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the system-generated primary key column.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.

For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • BankAccountNumber; string; The bank account number associated with a tax registration.
  • BankBranchId; integer; The unique identifier for the bank branch associated with a tax registration.
  • BankId; integer; The unique identifier for the bank associated with a tax registration.
  • CollTaxAuthorityId; integer; The unique identifier for the collecting tax authority.
  • Country; string; The name of the country where tax is registered.
  • CountryCode; string; The country code used to validate the tax registration number for a party tax profile.
  • DefaultRegistrationFlag; boolean; Indicates whether a tax registration is set as default registration. The default value is FALSE.
  • EffectiveFrom; string; The date when the tax registration for a period starts being effective.
  • EffectiveTo; string; The date when the tax registration for a period stops being effective.
  • InclusiveTaxFlag; boolean; Indicates whether a tax registration is tax inclusive. The default value is FALSE.
  • IssuingTaxAuthority; string; The issuing tax authority for a tax registration.
  • LegalLocationId; integer; The unique identifier of the legal location for a tax registration.
  • LegalRegistrationAddress; string; The address of the legal tax registration that is defined.
  • PartyCountryCode; string; The country of the party for which a tax registration is defined.
  • PartyName; string; The name of the party for which the party tax profile is defined.
  • PartyNumber; string; The party number for which the party tax profile is defined.
  • PartySiteNumber; string; The party site number for which the party tax profile is defined.
  • PartyTaxAllowOffsetTaxFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the party tax profile is set up to allow offset tax. The default value is FALSE.
  • PartyTaxClassificationCode; string; The tax classification code for the party tax profile associated with a tax registration.
  • PartyTaxInclusiveTaxFlag; boolean; Indicates whether a party tax profile supports inclusive taxes. The default value is FALSE.
  • PartyTaxProcessForApplicabilityFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the party tax profile is applied during the tax determination process.
  • PartyTaxProfileId; integer; The unique identifier for the party tax profile.
  • PartyTaxRoundingLevelCode; string; The rounding level code defined for a tax registration associated with a party tax profile.
  • PartyTaxRoundingRuleCode; string; The rounding rule code for the party tax profile associated with a tax registration.
  • PartyTypeCode; string; The party type code of the party tax profile.
  • RegimeTypeFlag; boolean; Indicates the type of the tax regime. Possible values are W for Withholding, I for Indirect, and NULL for Indirect.
  • RegistrationId; integer; The unique identifier of the system-generated primary key column.
  • RegistrationNumber; string; The company tax registration number assigned by a tax authority.
  • RegistrationReasonCode; string; The registration reason code for tax registrations.
  • RegistrationSourceCode; string; The registration source code for tax registrations.
  • RegistrationStatusCode; string; The registration status code for tax registrations.
  • RegistrationTypeCode; string; The tax registration type represents the legal type of tax for which a tax registration is issued, such as VAT.
  • RepresentativePartyTaxName; string; The name of the reporting party for tax registrations.
  • RoundingLevelCode; string; The value that specifies the rounding to apply to tax amounts on a transaction. The valid values are HEADER and LINE.
  • RoundingRuleCode; string; The rule that defines how the rounding must be performed on a value involved in a taxable transaction. Possible values range from the next highest value to the next lowest or nearest value.
  • Tax; string; The tax code associated with a tax registration.
  • TaxAuthorityId; integer; The unique identifier of the tax authority associated with an existing tax registration.
  • TaxClassificationCode; string; The tax classification code associated with a tax registration.
  • TaxJurisdictionCode; string; The location for which a tax registration is defined.
  • TaxPointBasis; string; The point in the receipt transaction process where taxes are accounted and reported to the tax authorities. Tax points can be classified into delivery-based and invoice-based categories.
  • TaxRegimeCode; string; The tax regime code associated with a tax registration.
  • UniquenessValidationLevel; string; The types of parties to be checked for duplicate tax registration numbers entered on a tax registration record.
  • ValidationLevel; string; The level at which validation for duplicate registration numbers are raised to users. Possible values are ERROR and WARNING.
  • ValidationRule; string; The code for the validation that is to be applied to tax registration numbers for a tax regime.
  • ValidationType; string; The validation type for tax registrations.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • ManageTaxRegistrationsRF: Finds all tax registrations that match the specified party number, party name, party type code, and country.
    Finder Variables:
    • country; string; The tax registration country of the resource.
    • partyName; string; The tax registration party name of the resource.
    • partyNumber; string; The tax registration party number of the resource.
    • partyTypeCode; string; The tax registration party type code of the resource.
  • PrimaryKey: Finds all tax registrations that match the specified registration identifier.
    Finder Variables:
    • RegistrationId; integer; The unique identifier of the tax registration.

item.description: The tax registrations resource is used to query, update, and create tax registrations.
